revised_title: Observations on Plant Seeds and Their Nourishment
tldr: Van Leeuwenhoek examines the structure and nourishment of plant seeds, comparing them to animal reproduction. He observes that seeds contain rudimentary plants and a fine flour for nourishment, and that different soils can alter plant growth. He also speculates on the potential for cross-pollination and hybridization of plants.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
